author: Special Correspondent
text:
An expert team of NBA (National Board of Accreditation) has visited the Government College of Engineering (GCT) here in connection with awarding International Accreditation under the Washington Accord.

Around 2,000 students are studying in the college. The college has an autonomous status.

The college applied to the NBA committee with the purpose of getting the international recognition. Following this, a group of about 10 members of the committee headed by Subash K. Avala inspected the facilities available.

R.S.D. Wahida Banu, principal, showed them around the college, and explained its achievements.

The committee members inspected the metallurgy, electrical and electronics engineering, civil and mechanical engineering departments.

The committee examined the laboratory, the experience of professors, and research papers.

They visited the hostels of boys and girls, digital library, research and development centre.

The committee members interacted with students too.

G. Vimala Roslin, vice-principal, professors, and the heads of the departments, were present during the inspection.

The committee expressed its satisfaction with the existing state of the art equipments available in various laboratories and the performance of the students, a press release of the college here has said.
title: Committee inspects GCT
